other_tests.findings: Histologic examination of the resected specimen showed a cellular tumor invading both dura and bone, with tumor cells negative for the B-cell antigen CD20 but positive for CD79a, indicating a plasma-cell tumor.
Lytic lesions in the distal right femoral metaphysis, proximal right tibial metaphysis, subtle lucencies in the left radius, left femur, and a sclerotic appearance in the L5 lumbar region.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Five months later, a new lytic bone lesion appeared in the left distal clavicle and another in the right greater trochanter. Six months later, no changes were noted.

other_tests.findings: Minimal increase in plasma cells to 2% with no evidence of a clonal population.
Progression of lytic disease with worsening lesions in the left distal clavicle and right greater trochanter.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Subsequent surveys showed relative stability of these lesions.

other_tests.findings: Showed two M components at very low concentrations.
Not specified (treatment given for pain control).
other_tests.changes_over_time: The bone lesions were unchanged radiographically.
